title: GAME 1270: Introduction to Game Design and Development Quiz #1
course: Introduction to Game Design and Development

sections.title: Vocabulary and Questions (1 point each / 15 points)
sections.instructions: Drag a letter from the word bank to each numbered prompt. Each letter is used exactly once.
prompts: What are the names of the oldest games ever found?
Popular game which origin came from China and then Japan?
First successful game company founded in 1860?
The name of the first true game designed to be played on a computer in 1961?
Which company did Nolan Bushnell and Ted Dabney found?
The biggest Arcade hit by Namco of 1980?
What was the VCS later renamed to?
What was Activision’s first game released in 1982?
What was Atari’s first big game hit?
The years of 1972 – 1976 for Electronic Gaming?
The years of 1983 – 1985 for Electronic Gaming?
The first home video game system?
One of the reasons why we play games?

sections.title: True or False (1 point each / 5 points total)
sections.instructions: Select True or False for each statement.
questions: CPU stands for Computer Programming Unit.
Xbox One, PlayStation 4 and Switch are PC platforms.
The Birth and Success of Electronic Gaming was driven by game players demanding better graphics, better audio and more processing power.
8-bit refers to the number of data transferred during each read and write of computer memory.
Emergent gameplay is when players have only one solution to one problem.
